name: Whose Mic Is It Anyway - Mixed Open Mic Event
description: Whose Mic Is It Anyway?: Open Mic NightsIt’s yours!An open mic event welcoming all musicians, comedians, poets, storytellers, and more. Whether you’re a first-timer or a seasoned performer, this open mic is for you.It will be a safe space (rather, a safe stage) for you to try out your new stand-up material, to perform a poem close to your heart, or sing that song you’re not confident about. No pressure, no judgement; just a place for you to own the spotlight and give the world your best.And for our audience: come and enjoy a fun evening with some of the cities most talented artists. (See performers? We’re already cheering for you!)This event happens every alternate week, so if you can’t make it this time, you can sign up for it next time!About the host: OninthoughOften branded as a sarcastic soul and an outright cynic, Oninthough is infamous for his observational humour and satirical comedy, often coupled with political undertones and religious overtones.Oninthough was crowned "Lord of Humour" at UNMAAD 2021, IIM-Bangalore. His humour has been lauded by the likes of internationally acclaimed comedians like Craig Shoemaker, Matt Banwart, and Raj Poojara, and renowned Indian comedian Kunal Kamra. He has also been featured by DailyHunt, DNA, Times Now, Indian Express, Aaj Tak, WhatsHOT Bangalore, The Sarcastic Indian, and many other publications.He has performed for audiences across 20+ cities, 7 countries, and 3 continents. With over 75k shares across social media, his punchlines and humour jabs are amongst the most shared comedic content.

name: Kavitayon Ki Dastak
description: Dialogues Cafe brings to you a Sunday full of kavitā and shāyari!If you love writing or just listening to Hindi poetry or couplets of shāyari or lyrical ghazals — we invite you to a poetic sundowner filled with hindi writing and sher-shāyari. Let`s get together for `Kavitāyon Ki Dastak`, an open mic — or rather an open mehfil — to set your mood and make you feel wholesome."utth ke mehfil se mat chale jānātum se raushan ye konā konā hai"Be a part of this community, share the love and lehzā with your words. Come join us to have agood time reciting, listening and absorbing the creativity of Hindi artists and shāyars. Wrap up your week with mellow vibes and be rejuvenated to start the next week afresh!Venue: Dialogues Café, KoramangalaEvery Second Sunday of the MonthTime: 5:00 pm to 7:00 pm

name: Dialogues with Books
description: Dialogues with Books Join us for our book club meetup every third Sunday of the month. Bring along your favorite book, the book you are currently reading, or any book that had an impact on you. Share your experience reading the book with fellow bibliophiles and participate in winding and fun discussions around the joy of reading. Do all this while sipping on coffee/tea or having a hot tasty snack from our cafe! Your Host - Bharat is an avid reader with a penchant for classical literature and philosophy. He also dabbles in writing with a diverse portfolio of works across tech, philosophy, magical realism and fantasy. His reading diet includes a mix of fiction and non-fiction with his favorite novels being The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, The Movable feast by Hemmingway and Crime and Punishment by Dostoevsky.Note: Rs.100 as cover is part of the ticket price.

name: Dialogues Poetry Open Mic
description: Lovers of poetry and prose — this one is for you!Whether you like listening, reading or performing poems or short stories, be ready to be entertained. We are on a journey to create safe spaces for the writers in town — to share their writing with like-minded people and become part of our community. You can hold us accountable for making you have a good time!Join us at Dialogues Cafe,Koramangala from 7:30 PM onwards, on every 3rd Sunday

name: "A Journey Within"
description: Event 1: 9th February 2025Title of event 1: The Love Languages Experience What Happens:●    Activity 1: An Icebreaker sharing or game●    Activity 2: Brief introduction to the 5 Love Languages through stories.●    Activity 3: Participants take a quick quiz to identify their love language.●    Activity 4: Group activity: Pair participants to create scenarios or gestures to express each love language ●    Activity 5: Pick an Oracle card●    Takeaway: Each person creates for themselves a personalized "Love Language Card" with tips on how to nurture their relationship with themselves and others. Event 2: 16th February 2025Title of event 2: Love Letters: The Art of Expressing AffectionWhat Happens:●    Activity 1: Icebreaker sharing/game (may include sharing memorable moments of receiving or writing a love letter)●    A short guided meditation on Compassion & Unconditional Love●    Activity 2: Guided session on crafting a heartfelt letter (whether for romantic love, self-love, or appreciation for friends/family).●    Activity 3: Optional sharing of letters in small groups or anonymously posting them on a “Wall of Love” at the café.●    Takeaway: Beautiful stationery or a postcard to encourage participants to continue writing love letters since the world needs more love letters  Event 3: 23rd February 2025Title for event 3: Love Yourself First: A Self-Love WorkshopTheme: Building Self-Compassion and Confidence What Happens: ●    Activity 1: Icebreaker ●    Quick mindfulness meditation to connect with self.●    Activity 2: Fun reflective exercise: “What I Love About Me” (participants list their strengths and joys).●    Oracle cards on love your body – each participant can pick one and journal for a few mins what it means to them, or share in a sharing circle●    Activity 3: Group activity: Create a "Self-Love Jar" with affirmations or small acts of kindness participants can gift themselves.●    Takeaway: A jar filled with affirmations or prompts to practice self-love regularly.

location.address: 1316/F, 1316/E, 18 B Main Rd, near VLCC BEAUTY CLINIC ( JP Nagar, Bangalore ), Marenahalli, 2nd Phase, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560078, India

organizer.name: The Kind Roastery and Brew Room

name: The Himalayan Table - A Garhwali Food Pop Up
description: Welcome to Shades of Garhwal - a traveling kitchen to promote the culinary delights from the Garhwal region.We may have pursued very different careers, but we share a deep love for food and how it connects us to the world. For us, exploring a new country isn’t complete without a visit to the local grocery stores to discover fresh produce and unique ingredients. Cooking and hosting have always been second nature to us, and as proud Pahadi women, we’ve embarked on a journey to rediscover and preserve the rich culinary heritage of the Garhwal region.For us, food is more than just sustenance—it’s a way to connect, to share, and to bond. Through this pop-up, we want to bring people together to savor authentic Garhwali flavors while immersing in the history, culture, and traditions that make each dish special. It’s not just a meal; it’s a celebration of heritage and a chance to create meaningful memories around the table.We hope to see you soon! ❤️- Salomi & Pushkina

location.address: 56, 1st Main Rd, Domlur I Stage, 1st Stage, Domlur, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560071, India

name: Colour Reduction Linocut Printing Workshop
description: Colour Reduction Linocut Printing Workshop 1 day workshop All the materials will be provided. The tools will be provided only for use. No prior experience required, we will teach you from scratch.You take home your carved block with 2 prints. We’ll be teaching colour reduction linocut. The size of the block is A5. We will be printing a colour linocut with two layers of colour depending on the composition. If you have a composition in mind that you want to work on, you can get the sketch or a print out of it. If you don’t have anything specific in mind, you choose from the references we have.*Please keep in mind to choose a simple composition. Avoid compositions that require a lot of intricate carving.*Please reach the venue by 11am. Avoid wearing light coloured clothes.Join us at Studio Sakura 🌸 to unleash your creativity and experience the magic of printmaking.

location.address: 34, Rest House Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Sampangi Rama Nagara, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560001, India

organizer.name: Studio Sakura
organizer.description: Printmaking Studio

name: The Analog Club
description: Step back in time at The Analog Club, a new event series by the Studio by Copper + Cloves. Imagine walking into a busy cafe and seeing not a single phone, no-one taking selfies and no one around you scrolling. Disconnect from devices for 3 hours of unplugged experience—we'll have books, board games, music, crochet, and of course, food! But this isn't about structured activities or organised fun, just genuine connection and relaxation. The event will be fluid- you can dip into activities if you want, or you can just chat to new people or graze at our high tea counter!Meet new friends, sketch, or read a book in quiet solitude (without being surrounded by people lost in their phones). We will not be doing social media on our phones at the event, we will only take photos with a camera.Embrace the analog experience, slow down, and reconnect in this crazy digital age! **Strictly no devices (no laptops, ipads, and you will be asked to keep your phone in a basket or in your bag- not in your pocket and no where on a table**Tickets are for entry and unlimited high tea from our renowned deli counter.

location.name: Copper + Cloves

organizer.description: We are all about nourishing food and creating spaces for connection!

name: Unlock Strength & Mobility For Your Spine
description: Our daily lives have us hunched over screens, desks, and phones, often without realizing the strain we put on our spines. Over time, this leads to stiffness, discomfort, and restricted mobility.This workshop is for anyone looking to counteract the effects of prolonged sitting and improve spinal health. Backbends aren’t just about flexibility—they help strengthen the back, improve posture, and create more space in the body. Whether you’re a beginner or experienced in movement, this session will guide you through safe, intentional back-bending techniques to build strength, release tension, and feel more open and energized.Meet Sanjana, the founder of Yogakalpa, a yoga studio and global community. A distinguished yoga teacher with Gold medal in National Yoga Championship and Silver medal in State Yoga Championship, Sanjana's expertise shines in advanced asanas empowering yogis to deepen their practice.

name: Pop-Up Brunch with Chef Clive Fernandes
description: Chef Clive Fernandes, a culinary expert in modern European cuisine, refined his craft at Auberge du Pommier in Toronto. He is known for blending classical techniques with contemporary creativity. Chef Clive will helm the Chef’s Table Dinner at the Pour Room presenting a three course meal, bringing deep respect for produce while crafting memorable dishes.

name: DINO-MITE PARTY with The Looroo Club
description: Hey little palaeontologists! 🦕🦖 Are you ready for a dino-mite adventure? Join us for the most roaring fun day ever at our Dino Play Date! We’ll tell amazing dino stories, get our hands messy with squishy sensory fun, and create some awesome dino art. There’ll even be nature adventures where you can explore like a real dinosaur hunter! And guess what? There’s yummy food from Karma & Kurry to chomp on while we’re having all this fun.So grab your hats and let’s dig up some prehistoric fun—this is one dino adventure you don’t want to miss! See you there, explorers!For children aged 3 to 8 years, accompanied by a parent.

location.address: 4th Floor, Chandre Gowda Arcade, next to Vajram Tiara Road, Avalahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560064, India

name: Sip & Paint
description: Get ready for an unforgettable afternoon filled with creativity, fun, and fabulous drinks! 🖌🍷 Join us at Bunny Bash in collaboration with Karma & Kurry for an exclusive Sip & Paint event that will ignite your artistic flair.Unleash your inner artist as you sip on carefully curated cocktails and delicious bites in a relaxed, social atmosphere. Whether you're a seasoned painter or a first-timer, our friendly instructors will guide you step by step through creating your masterpiece. All art supplies will be provided, so all you need to bring is your creativity and a love for fun!So, grab your friends, come for the sips, stay for the paints, and leave with a unique piece of art made by you! 🎨✨Spaces are limited, so be sure to book your spot in advance!

location.address: 4th Floor, Chandre Gowda Arcade, next to Vajram Tiara Road, Avalahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka 560064, India

name: Courtyard Picnic with Dough Re Mi
description: About PicnicJoin us under the canopy of our lush city oasis for a sun-soaked (fingers crossed!) afternoon filled with board games, wine, coffee, and irresistible picnic platesPicnic Plates by Dough Re MiTo be announced_________And don’t forget—your furry friends are welcome to join the fun too!See you at the yard for a perfect day out with great food, great coffee, and even better company. Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Children above the age of 3 need a ticket to attend the event.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Bringing outside food into the yard area is not permitted.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Movie Under the Stars | Film: No Reservations
description: Join us for an open-air screening of No Reservations (2007), with a three-course dinner and popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the moviePerfectionist chef Kate Armstrong (Catherine Zeta-Jones) runs her kitchen with precision and passion—until life serves up an unexpected twist. When she becomes the guardian of her young niece, Kate’s carefully curated world is turned upside down. Enter Nick (Aaron Eckhart), a free-spirited sous chef whose charm and spontaneity challenge Kate’s strict ways. As simmering tensions give way to unexpected warmth, No Reservations becomes a heartwarming story about love, food, and finding joy in the unplanned moments of life.No Reservations is the ultimate comfort watch—filled with stunning kitchen scenes, heartfelt moments, and a romance that unfolds over exquisite meals. Paired with a thoughtfully curated three-course dinner, this open-air screening promises an experience that’s as rich and indulgent as the dishes on screen. Come hungry for both food and feels!Please note: This experience includes a special course by Hello Tempayy.3-Course Dinner Menu by Chef Rhea AaronTo be announced______Terms and ConditionsThe management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In the event of rain leading to a complete washout, Courtyard reserves the right to cancel the event. In such cases, a full refund for the ticket will be issued.

name: Kagero-za (1981) with The Parallel Cinema Club
description: Our weekly meetings consist of a screening of an arthouse film, followed by a discussion. The discussion is led by one of our members, or sometimes a guest speaker, and encourages members to share their thoughts and interpretations of the film.Who are The Parallel Cinema Club?We are a community-run film society based out of Bangalore and Hyderabad. We are a group of film enthusiasts who meet up once a week to discuss the reel world, auteurs and themes, and occasionally host guest lectures.

name: Linocut Print Making - Tote Bag Workshop
description: 🖤 Linocut Print making Tote Bag Workshop 🎨Explore your creative side in this hands-on printmaking workshop, where you'll design and carve your own linocut stamp and print it onto a canvas tote bag! Whether you're a beginner or an experienced artist, this workshop is all about bold designs, inky hands, and one-of-a-kind creations.You'll learn the art of linocut carving, inking, and printing—then bring your masterpiece to life on a tote bag that’s as stylish as it is sustainable. Walk away with a unique, hand-printed bag and the skills to keep printing long after the workshop ends!✨ No experience needed—just bring your creativity! ✨Reserve your spot now! 🖤🎨
